title: Shinminato, Toyama
text:
was a <a href="Cities%20of%20Japan">city</a> in <a href="Toyama%20Prefecture">Toyama Prefecture</a>, Japan. The city was founded on 15 March 1951 and dissolved in November 2005.
Demographics.
As of 2003, the city had an estimated <a href="population">population</a> of 37,094 and the <a href="population%20density">population density</a> of 1,146.29 persons per km². The total area is 32.36 km².
History.
On November 1, 2005, Shinminato, along with the towns of <a href="Daimon%2C%20Toyama">Daimon</a>, <a href="Kosugi%2C%20Toyama">Kosugi</a> and <a href="%C5%8Cshima%2C%20Toyama">Ōshima</a>, and the village of <a href="Shimo%2C%20Toyama">Shimo</a> (all from <a href="Imizu%20District%2C%20Toyama">Imizu District</a>), was merged to create the city of <a href="Imizu%2C%20Toyama">Imizu</a>, and no longer exists as an independent <a href="Municipalities%20of%20Japan">municipality</a>.
Places of interest.
This city was famous for such places as Shinminato-Bridge, <a href="Kaiwo%20Maru%20%281930%29">Kaiwo-maru</a> Park, Shinminato Fishery, Classical Float Parade in October, and the Uchikawa River.
